title: Ben Yehoyada on Arakhin
text: And that which will be played in the days of the Messiah, "eight" (Psalms 12:1; Psalms 16:11): With God's help, it appears to me that the reason is that after the arrival of the messiah, the fifty gates of understanding (binah) will be lit, which is the fullness of freedom, and there will be freedom from the angel of death and freedom from the subjugation of the [other nations]. And binah is the eighth sefirah. That is why the harp will have eight strings, as a hint to 'understanding.' And that hint is in the [word,] harp (kinor), which is (when moving the letters around) ner kaf-vav (light of 26) - such that the (four letter) name of His Existence, which has a numerical equivalent of 26, should shine completely.
